result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Shelvik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher L Shelvik is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher L Shelvik was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 7 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

No firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and any treatment deemed appropriate.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court or agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 12/11/2015.

Defendant Christopher L Shelvik in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Christopher L Shelvik in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation, however,  agent  is requesting another review.  Additional review set for 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Christopher L Shelvik in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

As to Count 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 7 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 25 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/11/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" programming.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete any recommended treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court or agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No firearms.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christopher L Shelvik in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial.  Parties have come to a resolution and are prepared to proceed with plea hearing. 

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED.

As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
